intro: Minuartia orthophylla, commonly known as the upright sandwort, is a low-growing, mat-forming perennial plant belonging to the family Caryophyllaceae. It is characterized by its small, fleshy leaves and clusters of pink or white flowers that bloom in early summer. This species is typically found in rocky or sandy soils, often in alpine or arctic environments. It thrives in well-drained conditions and is adapted to withstand harsh environmental conditions. Minuartia orthophylla is a hardy plant that plays a role in stabilizing soil in its native habitats.
